title: CANON system uses JSONL output model — templates reference CANON-*.md files that don't exist as standalone docs
description: The CANON system is implemented as JSONL-formatted audit outputs (e.g., docs/audits/multi-ai/*/canon/CANON-AI-OPTIMIZATION.jsonl) and canonical document templates (CANONICAL_DOC_TEMPLATE.md, CANON_QUICK_REFERENCE.md). However, no dedicated CANON-*.md files exist in a standard location. The templates reference a pattern (CANON-NNNN numbered entries) that maps to Firestore validation schemas rather than standalone markdown docs. This dual interpretation could confuse new contributors.
recommendation: Add a brief note in CANON_QUICK_REFERENCE.md clarifying that CANON entries are JSONL audit outputs, not standalone markdown files.
evidence:
docs/templates/CANONICAL_DOC_TEMPLATE.md exists (469 lines) — template for canonical documents
docs/templates/CANON_QUICK_REFERENCE.md exists (171 lines) — references CANON-NNNN pattern
docs/audits/multi-ai/maa-2026-02-17-182d43/canon/ — contains JSONL CANON files
No standalone CANON-*.md files exist in docs/reviews/CANON/ or similar
suggested_fix: Informational. Either: (A) Create a docs/reviews/CANON/ directory with canonical markdown docs as referenced in templates, or (B) Update CANON_QUICK_REFERENCE.md to clarify the JSONL output model is the canonical approach.
suggestion_text: Accept at S3. Minor documentation clarity issue. The CANON system works but the naming/location could be clearer for new contributors.
counter_argument: The CANON system is well-documented in templates. Contributors following the templates will find the right approach. The dual naming (CANON-*.md vs CANON-*.jsonl) reflects evolution of the system.
